intro: Osteospermum barberae, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces numerous small, fluffy seeds in its composite flower heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Osteospermum barberae is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
